title: Most overpowered champions of all time
body:
Not counting bugs

Edit: Added 11-20
Edit2: Added 21-30

1. Double Gold Card Beta TF 
2. Beta or 5/3 HP Jax
3. Release Xin Zhao
4. Release LB
5. Pre-hotfix Udyr
6. Healing Ezreal
7. Pre-hotfix Skarner
8. Season 1 Alistar 
9. Release Zyra
10. Season 3 Kassadin
11. Stun Evelynn
12. 6 Turret Heimerdinger
13. 4.20 Weedwick
14. 3.8 Nunu
15. Revolver Stacking Vlad/Release Vlad
16. Permaroot Ryze
17. Release Graves
18. Release Diana
19. AP Yi
20. 60% win rate Ahri
21. 60% win rate Sona
22. AP Rengar
23. AP Tryndamere
24. Madred's Bloodrazor stacking Twitch
25. Release Vayne 
26. Release Camille
27. Lee Sin before his 1000000 nerfs
28. Release Kalista
29. Tank Ekko
30. Azir before all his nerfs

replies.body: Where the FUCK is 5 Sunfire Cape Garen?

Lol Garen? Back in the day, Evelynn wasnt revealed by proximity. She could literally walk right up next to you and still be invisible....... with 5 Sunfires still burning you lmao

x10 worse than Garen

>
> Where the FUCK is 5 Sunfire Cape Garen?

Where the hell is 5 Warmogs Mundo?
Or Mundo with Force of Nature before it was nerfed then removed.
Sunfire capes are all I need, boots of swiftness give me speed.
The level 3 permaroot Ryze that existed for about a couple of weeks after one of his Season 5 reworks.

Let's not forget:

Release Azir (EDIT: Post Bugfix)
Release Kalista
Post Rework Release Fiora
Season 5 Release Ryze
Release Camille

Unsure about Darius/Mordekaiser post juggernaut update.
Azir was absolute garbage until like the 5th patch after his release when they finally removed all the ridiculous bugs he had.
AP {{champion:11}}
KASS SHOULD BE NUMBER 1 BECAUSE HE MADE AN ENTIRE 5 MAN TEAM FLASH OVER BARON PIT TO GET AWAY FROM HIM IN LCS LOL
Can I get a link?

Not a 5 man flash, but still three of them (clip is at 3 minutes)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tp5zUHf_Y8w
it was 3
Xerath.  This guy went 100-0 in 7 min.  He did say he was a masters smurf though, but still.

Surprised some incarnation of Kalista isn't on this list, and hotifxed Rengar after his release - now that was fucking crazy, not AP Rengar (maybe on URF? lmao)

and don't deny there was a patch or two where Jhin was legitimately broken. For a while that guy won 25% of all League games, or just about.

I'd also say Tankko and release Camille were pretty disgusting, to add some modern additions. Hell, throw Ivern in there too. He's broken but in such a wierd and passive kind of way it's hard to notice.

Honorable mention to Season 2 Kat, LeBlanc anytime after the assassin update, and pretty much any incarnation of Graves. Otherwise you hit the big ones.

- No AP Master Yi on the list
- No Stun from stealth Evelyn on the list.


smh

All of these were worse

Eve makes top 15

Master Yi was trash and only pub stomped, although he did so probably better than any champ ever 

He was picked in competitive play like 3 times

He was the least interactive champion in arguably the history of league of legends. He Q'd the wave every time it came at him (killing most if not all and chunking YOU for well over 300 damage after 1 item) and if you did manage to poke him down he would simply W for well over his entire health bar.

Pre rework Late Game AD Sion.

https://youtu.be/iURWfA4zNyA?t=17s
Release Xin'Zhao was the most overpowered. If you say anything else you haven't played the game when it happened.
I mean Tankko was fucking disgusting.  Did what normal Ekko did, but without being able to die and had the CC to function.
Beta Twisted Fate.
*up there at #1

Here are some points and facts I'd like to make:

- If Yasuo had a spot on this list, it would probably be a controversial or honorable mention since yes, his kit is over-tuned with a lot of safety and high damage & mobility, but has a lot of glaring weaknesses and up to now, he still has these points.

- Azir:
Yeah fck this bird. He had everything a mage could have: moderate CC, high DPS and good zoning & sieging power. I don't want to remember the time he was meta because his soldiers could potentially chunk you with 1 Q and 2-3 autos from it. Even tanks struggled trying to face him. I even cringed at how fast he can siege and/or take down squishies and tanks when I played him a few times.

- 99% Ban rate Kassadin:
To the people who are new to League, you're really glad you never had to face this. This was when Kassadin had a silence on his Q that could be as long as Fiddle's fear, his W used to steal mana from his targets and overall, he could potentially blow you up with just an R-W-Q-E combo.

His W didn't steal mana during his 99% ban rate days. His W mana steal was removed long before then when League was still removing some of their initial DotA carry-over mechanics to differentiate itself from its predecessor. It gave him mana on hit during the 99% ban rate days, but didn't steal it. That's a pretty important distinction.

Come to think of it, did he ever steal mana? I thought it was a mana burn, a la Anti-Mage.. Hmm... To the archives!

Edit: Found it. His mana drain was removed in patch V1.0.0.96. Very old players may recognize this as the time they were made men, as Xin Zhao was released this same patch, Wriggle's Lantern was introduced, and Season One began. Those same old players may also recognize this as "long before 99% ban-rate Kassadin."

> [{quoted}](name=RainXBlade,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FFPrLrWO,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2017-04-15T04:37:16.782+0000)
>
> Here are some points and facts I'd like to make:
> 
> - If Yasuo had a spot on this list, it would probably be a controversial or honorable mention since yes, his kit is over-tuned with a lot of safety and high damage & mobility, but has a lot of glaring weaknesses and up to now, he still has these points.

Yasuo has always been about frustration, not usually straight power.

> - 99% Ban rate Kassadin:
> To the people who are new to League, you're really glad you never had to face this. This was when Kassadin had a silence on his Q that could be as long as Fiddle's fear, his W used to steal mana from his targets and overall, he could potentially blow you up with just an R-W-Q-E combo.

And the worst part was, the 1% of times he was picked, the person playing him had no experience, was just picking "because he's OP", and would proceed to feed his ass off in laning and never scale to late game.

Wasn't release Azir like, super OP?  He had a ton of bugs, but the bugs were actually just holding him back.  I think it was something like, every patch after his release they nerfed him, but then they also fixed a bug, and that kept his winrate really high for a long time.
Started in Season 3, and 4.20 Weedwick still haunts my nightmares.
No Kalista, no Azir.

Release Ekko, Release pre-rework Darius, Sona just after her rework, Skarner shortly after Juggernaut update hit live, Release pre-rework Zyra. I forgot who the largest abuser of devourer's was. I always felt it was Udyr.

6 Cleaver Pantheon
4.20 WW was the biggest Devourer abuser.

Definitely {{champion:38}} 

Nothing even comes close

You forgot Release Zyra.

She was a 1v3 Triple Kill machine in every role.
6 Sunfire Pre-rework Twitch Pre-Hotfix
60% AP ratio on Kayle E in season 4, and Lichbane Kayle. (Multiple iterations)
You forgot AP master yi
I agree with everything on there. I would also add season 2 jayce but that is just me.
tank ekko was legit in every single game unless banned.
*sunfire stack evelynn was more than stun eve, there was literally no God damn counter play to that other than spending 500 gold for 5 mins
I think you're forgetting 6 Sunfire Eve and Twitch. And post-rework Morde. And post-rework Darius.
Stacking sunfire capes Twitch?
Tank ekko
Jungle alistar in season 2 was my bae

When TF's ult was on a 30 second cool down and was accessible at level one as a basic ability. And it was global (as in, no limits on where you could teleport to - you could literally teleport to ANYWHERE on the map).
wa- no beta nasus? where at 100 AP his ult did 100% of the targets health in damage every second
Not counting bugs

Lee sin seasons 1-7

and counting

- Release Aatrox
- Buffed after release Yasuo
- Sated Devourer 2 auto proc Vayne
Release Aatrox wasn't broken.
